ProbationSummary: Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence in the care and treatment of one patient, and repeated negligent acts and failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of two patients. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 08/08/2024, revoked, stayed, placed on three years' probation until anticipated end date of 08/07/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course and a medical record keeping course; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $17,173.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Min made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts and prescribed to an addict in the care and treatment of one patient; repeated negligent acts, excessively prescribed controlled substances, prescribed without an appropriate prior medical examination or indication, and failed to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of multiple patients. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 03/02/2023, revoked, stayed, placed on thirty-five months' probation until anticipated end date of 02/02/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing a prescribing practices course and a medical record keeping course; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; paying the Board its cost of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $22,000.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Min's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar license facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent committed gross negligence in the care and treatment of one patient. Effective 10/20/2022, revoked, stayed, placed on four years' probation until anticipated end date of 10/19/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing a clinical competence assessment program; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Wynne made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and failed to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of multiple patients. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 07/14/2021, revoked, stayed, placed on four years'  probation until the anticipated end date of 07/13/2025.Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing a medical record keeping course and an ethics course; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Wynne's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, knowingly making or signing a document directly related to the practice of medicine that falsely represented an existence of a statement of facts, and creating false medical records with fraudulent intent in the care and treatment of one patient; repeated negligent acts in the care and treatment of multiple patients; failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of two patients; and unprofessional conduct. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 04/26/2024, revoked, stayed, placed on seven years' probation until anticipated end date of 04/25/2031. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, maintaining a record of all controlled substances ordered, prescribed, dispensed, administered, or possessed and any recommendations or approvals to possess or cultivate marijuana; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $38,966.25; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent admitted to being convicted of one misdemeanor count of driving with a blood alcohol content of .08% or more; using drugs and/or alcohol in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to himself, another person, or to the public; and unprofessional conduct. Effective 07/26/2024, revoked, stayed, placed on five years' probation until anticipated end date of 07/25/2029. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, abstaining from the use of controlled substances; abstaining from the use of alcohol; providing 100 hours of medical or non-medical community service; completing an ethics course; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation; attending psychotherapy; notification of employer; submitting to biological fluid testing; attending substance abuse support group meetings; obtaining a worksite monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $17,504.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent was convicted of three felony counts of healthcare fraud and one felony count of conspiracy to commit healthcare fraud. Effective 11/14/2022, Respondent's previously surrendered license was reinstated, revoked, stayed, and placed on seven years' probation until anticipated end date of 09/04/2030. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, abstaining from the use of controlled substances; abstaining from the use of alcohol; submitting to biological fluid testing; notification of employer; attending substance abuse support group meetings; obtaining a worksite monitor; completing an education course and an ethics course; completing a clinical competence assessment program prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); completing a clinical diagnostic evaluation prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); submitting to a psychiatric evaluation prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); submitting to a medical evaluation and obtaining medical treatment prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); obtaining a billing monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; submitting proof of notification of Decision to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Rao made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and failing to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of multiple patients. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 12/01/2023, revoked, stayed, placed on thirty-five months' probation until anticipated end date of 10/31/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course and a medical record keeping course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $61,454.10; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Rao's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent admitted to practicing under the influence of a narcotic drug; using drugs and/or alcohol in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to herself, another person, or to the public; using drugs and/or alcohol to an extent that such use impaired her ability to practice medicine safely; self-administering controlled substances to herself; dishonest or corrupt acts; violating statutes regulating dangerous drugs or controlled substances; violating provisions of the Medical Practice Act; and unprofessional conduct. Effective 03/15/2024, revoked, stayed, placed on ten years' probation until anticipated end date of 03/14/2034. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, 180 days actual suspension from the practice of medicine beginning the sixteenth day after the effective date of the decision; notification to patients of probation status; prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances except when each of the following conditions are met: 1) Respondent must be working in a hospital, 2) Respondent must be working in her capacity as an anesthesiologist, and, 3) Respondent must be engaged in the peri-operative care of patients; prohibited from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; maintaining a record of all controlled substances ordered, prescribed, dispensed, administered, or possessed and any recommendations or approvals to possess or cultivate marijuana; abstaining from the use of controlled substances; abstaining from the use of alcohol; completing a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation; attending psychotherapy; submitting to a medical evaluation and obtaining medical treatment; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; completing a clinical diagnostic evaluation prior to practicing medicine; notification of employer; submitting to biological fluid testing; attending substance abuse support group meetings; obtaining a worksite monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $55,040.75; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar license facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient; and unprofessional conduct. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 10/18/2018, revoked, stayed, placed on eight years' probation (see below for anticipated end date). Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, abstaining from the use of controlled substances; abstaining from the use of alcohol; submitting to biological fluid testing; completing an ethics course; completing a clinical diagnostic evaluation; attending psychotherapy; obtaining a worksite monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; attending substance abuse support group meetings; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, and a medical record keeping course; completing a clinical competence assessment program; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring. In a subsequent matter, Respondent failed to comply with terms of his Board-ordered probation by failing to submit to biological fluid testing. Effective 03/11/2022, Respondent shall remain on probation under the same terms and conditions as indicated in case No. 800-2017-038264, except that his probation shall be extended by one year,(probation end date to be determined when pending disciplinary action is finalized).

Respondent committed acts of gross negligence, aiding and abetting the unlicensed practice of medicine and unprofessional conduct in the care and treatment of one patient. In a subsequent matter, Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 07/07/2023, revoked, stayed, placed on two years' probation to run consecutively from the conclusion of the probation term in Case No. 800-2019-052549, until anticipated end date of 01/12/2030. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $10,439.75; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Ramsey admitted to acts of gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and incompetence in the care and treatment of two patients, and made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, and incompetence in the care and treatment of three patients.  Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 10/28/2002, revoked, stayed, placed on five years' probation. Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, incompetence, and failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient; and general unprofessional conduct. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 09/09/2022, revoked, stayed, placed on four (4) years' probation until anticipated end date of 09/08/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; completing a clinical competence assessment program (Practice Restrictions: Must undergo a period of 100% concurrent proctoring for a minimum of 10 deliveries and 10 gynecological surgeries, until the proctor and the Board deem Respondent safe to practice independently; and restricted from taking any OB or surgical call until proctoring is successfully completed); obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants but shall not be prohibited from supervising his advanced practice nurse; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $2,640.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent admitted to being convicted of one misdemeanor count of driving with a blood alcohol content of .08% or more; using drugs and/or alcohol in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to himself, another person, or to the public; unprofessional conduct; and violating provisions of the Medical Practice Act. Respondent admitted to gross negligence when prescribing to one witness who was not his patient, committing acts of repeated negligence when prescribing to multiple witnesses who were not his patients, and unprofessional conduct. Effective 06/28/2024, revoked, stayed, placed on three years' probation until anticipated end date of 06/27/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, providing 30 hours of medical or non-medical community service; completing a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from providing medical services to family members, persons living or working in his household, or any persons who do not consult him in a clinical setting; maintaining a record of all controlled substances ordered, prescribed, dispensed, administered, or possessed and any recommendations or approvals to possess or cultivate marijuana; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $34,125.75; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of in-person medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility but is permitted to engage in telehealth services with patients from his residence to a patient's place of residence; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, incompetence, and failing to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of two patients; performing procedures in an unaccredited outpatient surgery setting; incompetence and dishonest or corrupt acts in the care and treatment of one patient; and unprofessional conduct. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 08/18/2017, revoked, stayed, placed on three years' probation (see below for anticipated end date). Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; completing a clinical competence assessment program; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring. In a subsequent matter, Respondent committed dishonest or corrupt acts; knowingly making or signing a document directly related to the practice of medicine that falsely represented an existence of a statement or facts; created false or misleading advertisements; disciplined by Nevada for failing to disclose the California disciplinary action in his renewal application; failed to obtain a fictitious name permit; failed to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient; unprofessional conduct; and failed to comply with the terms of his Board-ordered probation by failing to obey all laws, failing to comply with the Board's Probation Unit, and failing to obtain a practice monitor. Effective 05/05/2022, Case No. 09-2013-230441 shall remain in effect and is extended for seven additional years until anticipated end date of 11/25/2029 with additional terms and conditions including, but not limited to, ninety (90) days actual suspension from the practice of medicine beginning on the 16th day after the effective date of this decision; completing a medical record keeping course and an ethics course; and Respondent shall submit proof of current accreditation of his surgery center, D.P. Surgery Center. If he does not have proof of current accreditation, then he shall submit proof of closure of the facility.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with being convicted of conspiracy to acquire controlled substances by fraud, deception, and subterfuge; committing dishonest or corrupt acts; unprofessional conduct; knowingly making or signing a document directly related to the practice of medicine that falsely represented an existence of a statement of facts; violating professional confidence; being convicted of violating statutes regulating dangerous drugs or controlled substances; and using drugs in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to himself, another person, or to the public. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, 30 days' actual suspension to be served beginning the 16th day after the effective date of this decision; prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances in Schedules II-III during the first year of probation; prohibited from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; maintaining a record of all controlled substances ordered, prescribed, dispensed, administered, or possessed; abstaining from the use of controlled substances; providing 50 hours of medical community service; completing a prescribing practices course and an ethics course; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation; attending psychotherapy, if recommended; submitting to a medical evaluation and obtaining medical treatment; prohibited from practicing in the area of pain management and addiction medicine; notification of employer; submitting to biological fluid testing; attending substance abuse support group meetings; obtaining a worksite monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring. Respondent admitted to being disciplined by the Arizona Medical Board for committing unprofessional acts in the care and treatment of a single patient. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to: prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances and from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; surrendering of DEA permit prior to practicing medicine; abstaining from the use of controlled substances; abstaining from the use of alcohol; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; completing a professional boundaries program; completing a written examination; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); attending psychotherapy; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; submitting proof of notification of Decision to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Wong's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; paying costs associated with probation monitoring; completing a clinical diagnostic evaluation prior to practicing medicine (CONDITION SATISFIED); notification of employer; submitting to biological fluid testing; attending substance abuse support group meetings; and obtaining a worksite monitor.

Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, must practice in an Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education (ACGME)-accredited postgraduate training program for an additional twenty-four (24) months of postgraduate training credit in addition to the eighteen (18) months of postgraduate training credit completed at Scripps Clinic Internal Medicine program; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; completing an ethics course; submitting proof of notification of Decision to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Applicant's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 08/29/2024, probationary license issued and placed on three years' probation until anticipated end date of 08/28/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances, except that Respondent may possess medications lawfully prescribed to her by another practitioner for a bona fide illness or condition, and from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana, until successful completion of a clinical competence assessment program (CONDITION SATISFIED); if Respondent fails the clinical competence assessment program, prohibited from practicing medicine until providing proof to the Board that her DEA permit has been surrendered to the DEA, and shall not reapply for a new DEA permit without prior written consent from the Board or its designee; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; completing a clinical competence assessment program (Practice Restriction: Restricted from managing chronic pain patients without consulting a pain specialist); obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; prohibited from providing treatment to Respondent's family members or employees, including medical assistants, except that Respondent can provide treatment to her elderly father in emergency situations only, but may not provide controlled substances to him; submitting proof of notification of Decision and First Amended Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $8,000.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility or the patient has been discharged home from these facilities under Respondent's continuing care; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with using drugs and/or alcohol in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to himself, another person, or to the public; and being convicted of one misdemeanor count of driving with a blood alcohol content of .08% or more with the enhancement of driving with a blood alcohol content in excess of .15%. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, abstaining from the use of alcohol; abstaining from the use of controlled substances; submitting to biological fluid testing; providing 40 hours of medical or non-medical community service; completing an ethics course; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $13,656.25; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent was issued a probationary license for two misdemeanor convictions of driving under the influence of alcohol; discipline by the U.S. Air Force for the two convictions; a condition affecting his ability to practice medicine safely; and use of alcohol in a manner as to be dangerous or injurious to himself, another person, or to the public. Effective 09/21/2001, probationary license issued, placed on five years' probation (probation end date to be determined when tolled status is lifted). Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing and passing the Special Purpose Examination; abstaining from the use of alcohol; abstaining from the use of controlled substances; submitting to biological fluid testing; submitting proof of notification of Decision to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; and complying with Board's probation unit.

Dr. Hall made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts and unprofessional conduct in the care and treatment of two patients.  Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt.  Effective 12/30/2022, revoked, stayed, placed on four years' probation until anticipated end date of 12/29/2026.  Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course and a medical record keeping course; completing a clinical competence assessment program; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from providing care and treatment to patients under sixty (60) days of age; submitting proof of notification of Decision and First Amended Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; paying the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $4,858.75; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Hall's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Le made no admissions but was charged with repeated negligent acts in the care and treatment of multiple patients; and failed to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 03/25/2022, revoked, stayed, placed on four years' additional probation to run concurrent, but separate and apart from, the five years imposed by the probationary order in case no. 800-2015-016568, until the anticipated end date of 03/24/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course and a medical record keeping course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties, prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Le's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence in the care and treatment of one patient, repeated negligent acts and failing to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of two patients, and unprofessional conduct.  Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 09/23/2022, revoked, stayed, placed on five (5) years' probation until anticipated end date of 09/22/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances, except those drugs listed in Schedules III, IV, and V (this restriction shall not apply to controlled substances administered to patients who are admitted to the hospital and only for their immediate use while they remain so admitted), and from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; maintaining a record of all controlled substances ordered, prescribed, dispensed, administered, or possessed and any recommendations or approvals to possess or cultivate marijuana; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, and a medical record keeping course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $4,785.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent admitted to being disciplined by North Carolina for prescribing controlled substances to a colleague and the colleague's spouse without a documented medical reason. Effective 12/16/2021, revoked, stayed, placed on three years' probation (probation end date to be determined when pending disciplinary action is finalized). Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course and an ethics course; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Tewari admitted to knowingly making or signing a document directly related to the practice of medicine that falsely represented an existence of a statement of facts.  Dr. Tewari made no admissions, but was charged unprofessional conduct; gross negligence; repeated negligent acts; incompetence; dishonest or corrupt acts; committing acts involving dishonesty, fraud, or deceit with the intent to substantially benefit himself or another; and violating statutes regulating dangerous drugs in the care and treatment of his patients.  Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt.  Effective 11/30/1996 revoked, stayed, placed on three years' probation  until anticipated end date of 05/30/2026.  Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an ethics course; passing an oral clinical exam (condition precedent); submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with Board's probation unit; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Alvarez made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence, repeated negligent acts, aiding and abetting the unlicensed practice of medicine, and failed to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of two patients. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 05/12/2023, revoked, stayed, placed on four years' probation until anticipated end date of 05/11/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing a clinical competence assessment program; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course, a medical record keeping course, and an ethics course; obtaining a practice monitor; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants; paying the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $13,800.00; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Alvarez's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar license facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Dr. Matzner admitted to being convicted of one felony count for the sale, transportation, or offer to sell controlled substances; committed acts of gross negligence and repeated negligence in the care and treatment of five patients; prescribing without an appropriate prior medical examination or indication; and knowingly making or signing a document directly related to the practice of medicine that falsely represented an existence of a statement of facts. Effective 11/30/2018, revoked, stayed, placed on seven years' probation until anticipated end date of 11/30/2025.  Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, 30 days actual suspension from the practice of medicine (completed); prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances and from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; surrendering of DEA permit; providing 100 hours of non-medical community service; completing a prescribing practices course and an ethics course; obtaining a practice monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine;  prohibited from practicing any form of pain management; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Dr. Matzner's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar license facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent made no admissions but was charged with gross negligence and failure to maintain adequate and accurate medical records in the care and treatment of one patient. Acceptance of this stipulated settlement is not an admission of guilt. Effective 08/08/2025, revoked, stayed, placed on two years' probation until anticipated end date of 08/07/2027. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, completing an education course, a medical record keeping course, and a patient communication course; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $21,024.75; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent admitted to being convicted of making and subscribing to a false tax return, and committed dishonest or corrupt acts.  Effective 06/06/2019, revoked, stayed, placed on seven years' probation until anticipated end date of 06/05/2026. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, providing 100 hours of medical or non-medical community service; completing an ethics course; submitting to a psychiatric evaluation; submitting to a medical evaluation and obtaining medical treatment; obtaining a practice and billing monitor; prohibited from engaging in the solo practice of medicine; submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.

Respondent committed acts of gross negligence, repeated negligence, aiding and abetting the unlicensed practice of medicine, violating label requirements, and violating statutes regulating dangerous drugs or controlled substances in the care and treatment of three patients; and failed to obtain a fictitious name permit. Effective 03/16/2023, revoked, stayed, placed on five years' probation until anticipated end date of 03/15/2028. Terms and conditions include, but are not limited to, prohibited from ordering, prescribing, dispensing, administering, furnishing, or possessing any controlled substances and from issuing an oral or written recommendation or approval to possess or cultivate marijuana; completing an education course, a prescribing practices course and an ethics course;  submitting proof of notification of Decision and Accusation to required parties; prohibited from supervising physician assistants and advanced practice nurses; submitting quarterly declarations of compliance with all conditions of probation; complying with the Board's probation unit; prohibited from engaging in the practice of medicine in Respondent's or patient's place of residence, unless the patient resides in a skilled nursing facility or other similar licensed facility; reimbursing the Board its costs of investigation and enforcement in the amount of $15,000.00; and paying costs associated with probation monitoring.
